greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n > 1, concatenate distinct prime factors of n in decreasing order.
comment: n and a(n) have the same parity.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
formula: 2. order prime factors by decreasing size;
3. concatenate prime factors and interpret the result as a decimal number.
mathematica: f[n_] := FromDigits[ Flatten[ IntegerDigits /@ Reverse[ Flatten[ Table[ # [[1]], {1}] & /@ FactorInteger[n]]]]]; Table[ f[n], {n, 1, 70}]
xref: In A084317 the order of factors is increasing.
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 27 2003
ext: Edited by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 15 2003
